definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: In ancient times, when there is a Shaolin abbot of appealing to the field.
sentences.chinese: 在古代的時候，有一個少林寺的方丈到外地化緣。

sentences.english: And try not to poke your camera in the monks' faces at the traditional morning alms-giving in Luang Prabang.
sentences.chinese: 琅勃拉邦請不要在早晨給化緣的僧侶照相。

sentences.english: I wasted alms food meant for him.
sentences.chinese: 爲此我還浪費了化緣得來的食物。

sentences.english: Was this a veiled begging letter?
sentences.chinese: 這是一封遮遮掩掩的化緣信嗎？

definition: to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
to be in charge of something specific
to return to normal life (leaving a monastic order)
celestial troops and generals (idiom)/fig. superior forces
to take refuge in religious life
to present a treasure/to offer a valuable piece of advice/to show off what one treasures
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
driver (of a taxi etc) (loanword from Japanese) (Tw)
